meanings.definition: Of or relating to the sense of touch.
meanings.sent1: The soft, tactile fabric felt nice against her skin.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the tactile experience of running her fingers over the rough surface.
meanings.sent3: The tactile nature of the fluffy blanket made it irresistible to touch.
meanings.sent4: His words had a tactile quality, leaving a lasting impression on her heart.
meanings.sent5: The tactile sensation of the warm sun on her face was comforting.

meanings.sent1: The rough bark of the tree was a tactile reminder of nature's strength.
meanings.sent2: The smooth, tactile surface of the stone invited exploration.
meanings.sent3: The tactile reality of the sculpture made it hard to resist reaching out to touch.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were a tactile presence in the room, palpable to all.
meanings.sent5: The tactile feedback from the keyboard assured her that her message was sent.
